ygData.subject: Re: Looking for item
ygData.msgSnippet: My point exactally..  whats the point of playing the game with what you have muled over from another character.. hehe Does it make the game progress any
ygData.messageBody:
My point exactally..� whats the point of playing the game with what you have
muled over from another character.. hehe Does it make the game progress any
faster.. NO.�Just play the game as its meant, if you do it any other
way...why its just a glorified irc chat room.� You still cant fight anything
beyond your level, you just stand out someone whos trying to bypass the
system, and most people will look down on you as someone who cant handle the
game.� Nothing personal i just put all twinkies in the same catogery.� The
game is just not that hard, but as in real life everyone is looking for a
handout.� Later... Smile... :)
�
Duhase

-----Original Message-----
From: Mikaela [mailto:mikaela@...]
Sent: Friday, October 15, 1999 1:59 PM
To: EverQuest@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Looking for item


In my experience on The Rathe, the only level 2 players you will see in full
bronze got that full bronze from one of their older siblings, who DID it the
hard way to begin with...worked their way up the ladder until they were high
enough to acquire such good items.� I currently have only one persona in
EQ...a cleric who is almost level 40 now.� She acquired her exp and items
the hard way...fighting and dying for them, saving enough plat to buy them,
camping for hours and days on end for them, and trading some of them for
others.� I have all my banded from my early days and some other nice things
vaulted...I did not sell them.� Why? Because when my current persona DOES
get a sibling, you can bet that is whom they are going to go to. A Twinkie?
Yah, you betcha.� But don't forget....they were originally gotten the long,
hard way.�
�
Been there...done that....not gonna do it again.
�
Mikaela Tristram of The Rathe

-----Original Message-----
From: Whitmore, Lance < lwhitmore@...>
To: 'EverQuest@onelist.com' < EverQuest@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, June 14, 1999 9:34 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Looking for item



Sometimes I ponder this.� Why to people just give things away to people. Let
them work for it, or at least pay for it.� Especially when the person
receiving it has no idea where it came from.� Its funny and sad really, when
your in the newbie yard and you see a level 2 player chasing a snake around
in full bronze armor.� The Crude Stein is no big deal, but if someone wants
to give you something that is significant don't accept it.� Add a little
character to your character, so to speak. Get down in the trenches with the
rest of us, in the long run it will make you a better player.� Some call it
twinking, I call them Twinkies..� looks good yet not much substance. :) hehe

Anyways...�� have fun... hehe

Duhase - Veeshan


-----Original Message-----
From: kale usi [ mailto:kaleusi@...]
Sent: Saturday, June 12, 1999 10:34 AM
To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com; EverQuest@onelist.com; EQ_Neriak@onelist.com;
EQ_Potters@onelist.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Looking for item


From: kale usi <kaleusi@...>

Will pay good PP for a Crude Stein or the information leading to me
obtaining one (on Bertoxx server). Serious offers/info only. Please respond
if interested.
